page.title: 04Well Dressings
page.content: {Well Dressings}is an ancient Derbyshire custom which probaly originated from offering thanks to the pagan watergods it gradually became a Christian festival we interveiwed a lady from Hartington who told us a bit about the Well dressing. Hartington wells dressing is about 6 years old. The first Wells dressing started a long time ago then interest faded. Some people then decided it would be a good idea to start again. Wooden boards are filled with locally dug clay. An outline of the design is placed on the clay and pricked out to leave an outline is black knobbed to make a definite outline. Petals, grasses, seeds etc are used to fill in. The design is usually a religious picture. When the picture is finished it is put up near the well and blessed.
